title: 17-year-old killed in Norfolk shooting that injured two others
content:
Please install the latest Adobe Flash Player Plugin to watch this content.
NORFOLK, Va. (WAVY) — Norfolk police say a 17-year-old was killed and two others are in the hospital after a triple shooting near Military Circle.
Officers tell 10 On Your Side they responded to a 911 call just after midnight Tuesday. Paramedics say they found two males at the scene on North Military Highway near Poplar Hall Road with gunshot wounds.
They took both victims to Sentara Norfolk General Hospital. One man is expected to survive, but detectives say 17-year-old Don Demetrius Brown, Jr. died at the hospital.
Brown’s friends and family stopped by the scene Tuesday afternoon.
A 16-year-old girl said she had spoken to him a few hours before he died. WAVY.com is not using her name because she is a minor.
“I don’t understand why he wasn’t home, what he could have been doing right here at that time of the night,” she said. “I don’t know. But hopefully, we’ll get some type of answers.”
The girl remembered her friend as a fun, loving person who danced everywhere he went.
Brown’s cousin, Keron Green, said he boxed with Brown, and that the teenager wanted to become a longshoreman.
“He was a very loving person, a good spirit, fun to be around,” Green said. “He wanted to be better than what he was.”
Moments after Brown and the other victim arrived at the hospital, a third gunshot victim, a woman who had also been injured in the shooting, came to Sentara Leigh Memorial Hospital. Police say she is expected to survive, and they believe she was a bystander.
Police officers handcuffed a man at the scene, and confirmed they brought him in for questioning. They have not said whether he is a suspect, or if they’re looking for anyone else.
Officers were on scene investigating for more than six hours.
10 On Your Side is working to learn the latest in Norfolk Police’s investigation into this shooting. Call the Crime Line at 1-888-LOCK-U-UP if you know anything that could help them.
